metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16875 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Teluu pjproject (pjlib and pjlib-util) in PJSIPbefore 2.7.1. The ioqueue component may issue a double key unregistrationafter an attacker initiates a socket connection with specific settings andsequences. Such double key unregistration will trigger an integer overflow,which may cause ioqueue backends to reject future key registrations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16875` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpj2 - 2.7.2~dfsg-1
libpjlib-util2 - 2.7.2~dfsg-1
libpjmedia-audiodev2 - 2.7.2~dfsg-1
libpjmedia-codec2 - 2.7.2~dfsg-1
libpjmedia-videodev2 - 2.7.2~dfsg-1
libpjmedia2 - 2.7.2~dfsg-1
libpjnath2 - 2.7.2~dfsg-1
libpjsip-simple2 - 2.7.2~dfsg-1
libpjsip-ua2 - 2.7.2~dfsg-1
libpjsip2 - 2.7.2~dfsg-1
libpjsua2 - 2.7.2~dfsg-1
libpjsua2-2v5 - 2.7.2~dfsg-1
python-pjproject - 2.7.2~dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pjproject package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.2~dfsg-1').
